minigames.prompt: Take a picture of one of your most used source of information. It could be a book, electronic device, anything!

prompts.text: Where do you get your information and knowledge about the environment? Is it an electronic source, a book, or even a person? What makes this information reliable?

content.prompt: How is information different from knowledge?

answers.text: Information and knowledge are the same
Knowledge is the understanding and relevant information gained
Information is in a different language than knowledge
Knowledge requires less learning and understanding than information

content.answer: Knowledge is the understanding and relevant information gained

prompts.text: Think of one way you help reduce your environmental impact in your area. How would you test that you are making a difference? Come up with a hypothesis for an experiment to test your environmental impact.

content.prompt: What is the best way to test your hypothesis?

answers.text: Ask your friends if they think it�s correct
By looking it up on the Internet
By carrying out an experiment and recording results
By assuming the results of an experiment

content.answer: By carrying out an experiment and recording results

content.prompt: What is one of the first things you should do when you want to create an experiment?
What is a hypothesis?

answers.text: A scientific proposition to explain a process in nature or society
A scientific explanation to explain why you are correct
A scientific explanation to explain how you are incorrect
A scientific explanation to explain why you should practice sustainable actions

content.answer: A scientific proposition to explain a process in nature or society

content.prompt: Why do we do experiments?

answers.text: To better understand the world around us
To find the answer we are looking for

content.answer: To better understand the world around us

content.prompt: What is the last step of an experimental study?
What is the definition of a discovery?

answers.text: A new achievement that is being made in the course of scientific knowledge of nature and society
Information about an object, natural phenomenon, scientific discovery.

content.answer: A new achievement that is being made in the course of scientific knowledge of nature and society

content.prompt: True or false: There are still discoveries being made about sustainable practices in your area and around the world.

answers.text: A new achievement that is being made in the course of scientific knowledge of nature and society

the plant will grow very tall.

content.prompt: Chlorophyll is the substance that helps the leaves capture sunlight and transform it into sugars for the plant, as well as giving the plants their green color.
Which of the following is a true?

answers.text: A tree can release enough oxygen for a family of four to breathe within a year.
Driving a car for two hours uses the same abount of oxygen a tree produces in two years.
Chlorophyll is also found in algae and some bacteria.
All the above statements are true.

content.answer: All the above statements are true.

prompts.text: Many plants have to adapt to survive in their environment. Sometimes the environment changes so quickly that plants don't have the ability to adapt. What are some human-made adaptations that help us, but hurt plants?
List a couple of things that plants need in order to survive. Are these the same things we need to survive? What happens if there is too much of one resource?

content.prompt: What happens when a plant recieves too much heat?

answers.text: The plants grow and bloom more quickly than usual
The leaves are not their normal color
The plant looses a lot of moisture

content.prompt: Chlorophyll dies if the plant recieves too much direct sunlight.
Which types of plants have the adaptations to include waiting out exteme hot or cold temepratures before they begin to sprout?
What does it look like when plants have too much light?

answers.text: They bloom more and have more leaflets
The leaves turn away from the sun
They spread their roots our more under the soil
More chlorophyll is produced in the leaves to protect it

content.answer: The leaves turn away from the sun

content.prompt: Plants can grow in 0°C and below type temperatures

prompts.text: Which community (natural or artifical) is more environmentally friendly? Are there benefits to one or the other? List a couple of either communities you see in your area.

content.prompt: Match the items to thier community
What is a natural community?

answers.text: A group of plants and animals and their native habitat
A group of plants and animals that are not living in their habitat
A group of only plants living in their habitat
A group of only animals living in their habitat

content.answer: A group of plants and animals and their habitat

content.prompt: What does homogenous mean?

answers.text: Of having the same or similar features

content.answer: Of having the same or similar features

content.prompt: What is an artifical community?

answers.text: A group of plants and animals and their native habitat
A group of plants and animals that are not living in their habitat
A group of only plants living in their habitat
A group of only animals living in their habitat

content.answer: A group of plants and animals that are not living in their habitat

content.prompt: Plants and animals don't need each other to exist.
Homogenous conditions of existence means...

answers.text: different plants can't live in the same area
different plants can live in the same area
only specific plants can live in tbe same area
No plants can live in the same area

content.answer: different plants can live in the same area

content.prompt: Which of the following is the main way droughts affect aquatic environments?

answers.text: Droughts make non-aquatic animals thirstier and therefore drink more of their water.
Droughts make the bodies of water shallower, through evaporation, killing off aquatic animals.
Droughts cause an increase in the fish population.

content.answer: Droughts make the bodies of water shallower, through evaporation, killing off aquatic animals.
